ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: The grammar of graphics as shown in 'ggplot2' has provided an expressive API for users to build plots. 'ggside' extends 'ggplot2' by allowing users to add graphical information about one of the main panel's axis using a familiar 'ggplot2' style API with tidy data. This package is particularly useful for visualizing metadata on a discrete axis, or summary graphics on a continuous axis such as a boxplot or a density distribution.

The grammar of graphics as shown in 'ggplot2' has provided an expressive API for users to build plots. 'ggside' extends 'ggplot2' by allowing users to add graphical information about one of the main panel's axis using a familiar 'ggplot2' style API with tidy data. This package is particularly useful for visualizing metadata on a discrete axis, or summary graphics on a continuous axis such as a boxplot or a density distribution.

name: r-ggside
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-ggside
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ggside_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ggside/ggside_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 46199c1e2f0e5e50de40d7e83bb3c64528e55d3d5f556fca0c83ecbc5a8a2777

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-cli
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.5.0
    - r-glue
    - r-gtable
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales >=1.3.0
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-cli
    - r-ggplot2 >=3.5.0
    - r-glue
    - r-gtable
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales >=1.3.0
    - r-tibble
    - r-vctrs

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ggside')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ggside')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/jtlandis/ggside
  license: MIT
  summary: The grammar of graphics as shown in 'ggplot2' has provided an expressive API for users to build plots. 'ggside' extends 'ggplot2' by allowing users to add graphical information about one of the main panel's axis using a familiar 'ggplot2' style API with tidy data. This package is particularly useful for visualizing
    metadata on a discrete axis, or summary graphics on a continuous axis such as a boxplot or a density distribution.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
